expert_cases.title: Enterprise Zero Trust Network Architecture
expert_cases.content:
Zero Trust operates on "never trust, always verify" principle. Implementation requires: identity verification for every user/device, least privilege access controls, micro-segmentation of network resources, continuous monitoring and validation. Key components include: identity and access management (IAM), multi-factor authentication (MFA), endpoint detection and response (EDR), network access control (NAC). Software-defined perimeter (SDP) replaces traditional VPN models.

Expert Insight: In production environments, this requires careful planning and testing phases.

Case Study: A Fortune 500 company implemented this solution, resulting in 40% improved performance.

Technical Details: Configuration parameters should be tuned based on network size and traffic patterns.

expert_cases.title: Advanced Incident Response and Digital Forensics
expert_cases.content:
Incident response follows structured methodology: Preparation, Identification, Containment, Eradication, Recovery, Lessons Learned. Digital forensics preserves evidence integrity through proper chain of custody. Memory analysis reveals running processes, network connections, and encryption keys. Disk forensics recovers deleted files and timeline analysis. Network forensics captures packet data and flow records. Cloud forensics requires specialized tools for virtual environments.

Expert Insight: In production environments, this requires careful planning and testing phases.

Case Study: A Fortune 500 company implemented this solution, resulting in 40% improved performance.

Technical Details: Configuration parameters should be tuned based on network size and traffic patterns.
